title: Guitar Masters 09 of 16 Dykes, Gulezian, Juber, Nakagawa
description:
Guitar Masters 09 of 16 Dykes, Gulezian, Juber, Nakagawa

Still today people ask me about the old guitar torrents that I shared years ago at my first times at the Bay.
They often tell me that is difficult to find them all, cause the TPB search engine sucks, cause their trackers are dead and they seem deserted.
So I've decided to reshare them all with a unifying pattern in the name of the torrent:

Guitar Masters

followed by a progressive number, so those who are interested can find them easily.
They deal primarily with fingerstyle, and the albums they contain are not generally easy to find... so dont expect overall 320 bitrates.
The founding criterion here is to find and remember them as a document of great music of the past.

Enjoy :)

DOYLE DYKES

Doyle Dykes is an American country acoustic guitarist.
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doyle_dykes" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doyle_dykes</a>   <a href="
http://www.doyledykes.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.doyledykes.com/</a>

Although influenced by a wide variety of musical styles and musicians from the country of Chet Atkins to the rock and roll of Duane Eddy and the Beatles, Dykes has developed a distinct, recognizable sound that amazes audiences with skill while capturing hearts with sincerity and soul.

What follows is a collection of some of his albums... Enjoy...

__________________________________

Doyle Dykes - Gitarre 2000
Doyle Dykes - H.E.A.T
Doyle Dykes - Dykesology
Doyle Dykes - 2000 - Zelf
Doyle Dykes - Chameleon
Doyle Dykes - Country Fried Pickin'
Doyle Dykes - Fingerstyle Guitar


*****************************

MICHAEL GULEZIAN

Michael Gulezian is an american composer and fingerstyle guitarist. 
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Gulezian" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Gulezian</a>   <a href="
http://www.timbrelinemusic.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.timbrelinemusic.com/</a>

He is noted for dramatic compositions, a penchant for manipulating metre, an affinity for extreme open tunings, and an unconventionally free two-handed technical approach. Gulezian's use of bottleneck slide on 12-string guitar, coupled with his command of reverse analog reverbs have made his recordings notable for their dream-like sonic atmosphere. Gulezian inhabits a musical territory between his mentor John Fahey, and his friend and colleague Michael Hedges.

What follows is a collection of some of his albums... Enjoy...

_________________________


michael gulezian - concert at st. olaf college
michael gulezian - distant memories and dreams
michael gulezian - language of the flame
michael gulezian - the dare of an angel
michael gulezian - unspoken intentions (1979)


*****************************

LAURENCE JUBER

Laurence Juber is an english guitarist (with a past as lead guitarist in McCartney's Wings). 
   <a href="
http://www.laurencejuber.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.laurencejuber.com/</a>

He's a master of acoustic finger style, but with less of the trick-guitar mishmash that seems obligatory among the high-octane pickers. He has a fluid style that shifts gears through simultaneous jazzy chording, leads, and bass lines, while weaving in and out of musical thoughts faster than a Formula One racer...

What follows is a collection of some of his albums.

_______________________________

Laurence Juber - Solo Flight
Laurence Juber - Altered Reality
Laurence Juber - Lj
Laurence Juber - Mosaic
Laurence Juber & Preston Reed - Grove Masters
Laurence Juber - Naked Solos
Laurence Juber - Winter Guitar

	
*****************************

ISATO NAKAGAWA

Isato Nakagawa is a japanese guitarist.
There's no official site available in western languages as far as I can see, so little I can say about his musical career...

He makes a great use of open tunings and percussive techniques.

I associate his music to the japanese concept of "shibumi": a not glaring beauty, founded on the essence of shapes, hues and materials. It's a subtle balance obtained through a search for simplicity, without useless ornamentation. They say you cant learn shibumi: you got to find it in yourself: it's a path where Nakagawa has threaded far...

It would be nice if some japanese friends would provide more albums of this marvelous artist with a western transliteration of the titles (a friend of mine did this for the album "Footprints"). It's sad that such an artist would remain hidden because of an alphabet difference. 


What follows is a collection of some of his albums.

_______________________________

Isato Nakagawa - Footprints
Isato Nakagawa - Dream Catcher
Isato Nakagawa - Rainbow Chaser
Isato Nakagawa - Tree Circle
